    • getTileEntity

      public DigitalInterfaceTileEntity getTileEntity()

    • getTardimData

      public com.swdteam.tardim.TardimData getTardimData() throws dan200.computercraft.api.lua.LuaException
      Get TARDIM's data, which we need for *every* function

      We can't do a simple TardimManager.getFromPos(getTileEntity().getPos())

      because if someone attempts to call a method outside a TARDIM, this would create a new TARDIM/Point to the one with ID of 0 (Due to the way TardimSaveHandler.loadTardisData works). Which is obviously not what we want.

      So instead we use this, and get the ability to give user a LuaException if they think that fiddling with time is funny This is mostly a copy of getIDForXZ function with some added checks

      Returns:
      TardimData of the TARDIM that the peripheral is in
      Throws:
      dan200.computercraft.api.lua.LuaException - if the peripheral is not in a TARDIM

    • getCurrentLocation

      @LuaFunction(mainThread=true) public final dan200.computercraft.api.lua.ObjectLuaTable getCurrentLocation() throws dan200.computercraft.api.lua.LuaException
      Get the current location of the TARDIM
      Returns:
      ObjectLuaTable of the current location with the following keys:
      • dimension - String of the dimension
      • pos - table with the keys x, y, z that hold numbers
      • facing - String of the facing
      Throws:
      dan200.computercraft.api.lua.LuaException

    • getTravelLocation

      @LuaFunction(mainThread=true) public final dan200.computercraft.api.lua.ObjectLuaTable getTravelLocation() throws dan200.computercraft.api.lua.LuaException
      Get the current location of the TARDIM
      Returns:
      if there is no destination returns null.

      Otherwise, ObjectLuaTable of the current location with the following keys:

      • dimension - String of the dimension
      • pos - table with the keys x, y, z that hold numbers
      • facing - String of the facing
      Throws:
      dan200.computercraft.api.lua.LuaException

    • setDimension

      @LuaFunction(mainThread=true) public final void setDimension(String dimension) throws dan200.computercraft.api.lua.LuaException
      Set dimension for the TARDIM to travel to

      This is a serious hazard right now due to the fact that I am unable to check if the dimension is valid.

      TODO: If invalid dimension is given, the TARDIM is unable to land until the dimension is changed. Add proper checks.

      Parameters:
      dimension - String of the dimension e.g. "minecraft:overworld"
      Throws:
      dan200.computercraft.api.lua.LuaException
